Package controller

Interface Features

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ControllerGUI
    public interface Features
    Interface to incorporate the necessary features in the Graphical User Interface.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • login

        void login​(java.lang.String userName,
           boolean createUser)
        Method for Login Screen.
        Parameters:
        userName - the current user.
        createUser - to check if it's a new user.

        Parameters:
        features - Object of features to be added.

        Method to create the portfolio screen of the program.

      • addPortfolio

        void addPortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                  java.lang.String portfolioType)
        Method to add the Portfolio screen to the JFrame.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The name of the portfolio.
        portfolioType - Type of portfolio - flexible or inflexible.

      • saveAndBack

        void saveAndBack​(Portfolio nPortfolio)
        Method to persist the data and return to the previous screen.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - The name of the portfolio.

      • addStock

        void addStock​(Portfolio nPortfolio,
              java.lang.String stockName,
              java.lang.String stockQuantity,
              java.lang.String brokerFee,
              java.lang.String buyingDate,
              boolean create)
        Method to add stock to a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - The name of the portfolio.
        stockName - The name of the stock.
        stockQuantity - The quantity of stocks to be purchased.
        brokerFee - The broker fee for transaction.
        buyingDate - The date on which the stocks need to be bought.
        create - to check if it's a new user.

      • getCompositionScreen

        void getCompositionScreen()
        Method to display the screen with options to view the composition of a portfolio.

        Method to take the user back to the home screen of the GUI.

        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio.

        Method to display the screen for editing the portfolio.

        Method to display the screen for loading the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio.

      • deleteStock

        void deleteStock​(Portfolio nPortfolio,
                 java.lang.String stockName,
                 java.lang.String quantity,
                 java.lang.String brokerFee,
                 java.lang.String sellingDate,
                 boolean b)
        Method to delete stocks from a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - Name of the portfolio.
        stockName - Name of the stock to be deleted.
        quantity - Quantity of stocks to be deleted.
        brokerFee - The broker fee for the transaction.
        sellingDate - The date on which the stocks need to be sold.
        b - To check if it's a new user or not.

      • getEvaluation

        void getEvaluation​(java.lang.String text,
                   java.lang.String text1)
        Method for getting the evaluation of a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        text - Name of the portfolio.
        text1 - Date on which evaluation is to be performed.

      • getEvaluationScreen

        void getEvaluationScreen()
        Method to display the screen for getting the evaluation of a portfolio.

      • getCostBasis

        void getCostBasis​(java.lang.String text,
                  java.lang.String text1)
        Method to get the Cost basis of a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        text - Name of the portfolio.
        text1 - Date on which cost basis is to be performed.

      • getCostBasisScreen

        Method to display the screen for getting the cost basis of a portfolio.

      • getDollarCostScreen

        void getDollarCostScreen()
        Method to display the screen for getting the Dollar Cost of a Portfolio.

      • startAddingStock

        void startAddingStock​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                      java.lang.String totalStocks,
                      java.lang.String amount,
                      java.lang.String startDate,
                      java.lang.String continuous,
                      java.lang.String endDate,
                      java.lang.String range)
        Method to start adding stocks to a strategic portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - Name of the portfolio.
        totalStocks - Total number of stocks to be added.
        amount - Total amount of money to be invested.
        startDate - The date from which the portfolio should start buying stocks.
        continuous - parameter to check if this is continuous configuration.
        endDate - The date on which the portfolio should stop buying stocks.
        range - Range of days to purchase stocks in a strategic portfolio.

      • addWeightStockToPortfolio

        void addWeightStockToPortfolio​(java.lang.String stockName,
                               java.lang.String stockWeight)
        Method to strategically buy stocks based on the weight provided by the user.
        Parameters:
        stockName - Name of the stock to be added.
        stockWeight - Proposed Weight to purchase the stocks.

      • createStrategyPortfolio

        void createStrategyPortfolio​(Portfolio nPortfolio,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stockList,
                             java.lang.String amount,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> weightOfStocks,
                             java.lang.String startDate,
                             java.lang.String endDate,
                             java.lang.String range,
                             boolean i)
        Method to create Strategic Portfolio.
        Parameters:
        nPortfolio - Name of the portfolio.
        stockList - List of stocks to be added.
        amount - The total amount to be invested.
        weightOfStocks - Proposed Weight to purchase the stocks.
        startDate - The date from which the portfolio should start buying stocks.
        endDate - The date on which the portfolio should stop buying stocks
        range - Range of days to purchase stocks in a strategic portfolio.
        i - Interval provided by the user.

      • getPerformance

        void getPerformance​(java.lang.String text,
                    java.lang.String text1,
                    java.lang.String text2)
        Method to get the performance of a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        text - Name of the portfolio.
        text1 - Start date for performance analysis.
        text2 - End date for performance analysis.

      • getPerformanceScreen

        void getPerformanceScreen()
        Method to display the screen for selecting Performance of a portfolio.
